alert.note: Alert for Elkhart; St. Joseph (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 20 at 10:43PM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 AM EDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern Indiana, including the following counties, Elkhart and St. Joseph IN. * WHEN...Until 145 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1041 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to northward moving thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain has already fallen within the advised area. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... South Bend, Mishawaka, Gulivoire Park, Granger, Osceola, Wakarusa, Lakeville, Woodland and Wyatt. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
